Here We Go!!!!

Kieran Tierney agrees to join Arsenal

Arsenal Football Club is delighted to announce that Scottish international defender Kieran Tierney has agreed to join the Gunners on a long-term contract for an undisclosed fee.

Tierney (22), who will join Arsenal from Scottish Premiership side Celtic, is predominantly a left full-back and has represented his country Scotland at youth level, Under-19s and has made 12 appearances for the national team.

Kieran Tierney started his career with his hometown club Celtic, where he progressed through the youth ranks to become a regular in the first team, making 102 appearances for the Scottish Premiership side.

Tierney’s performances for Celtic earned him recognition on the international stage, firstly with the Scotland under-19s, and later became a full international, making his debut for Scotland in a friendly win over Denmark in March 2016.

Manager Unal Emery said: “We are delighted that Kieran Tierney has agreed to join us. We have been monitoring him for some time now and are really pleased that we’ve been able to agree this move today. Kieran Tierney is a strong left-sided defender with good experience at both club and international level. He is a technically gifted player, a good crosser in the final third and strong in the air. Kieran Tierney will add quality to our squad and of course, to our defensive unit. We all look forward to him playing for us.”

The deal is subject to the completion of formal registration processes.
